description: Creates an ID namespace object which will help customers provide metadata explaining their dataset and how to use it. Each ID namespace must have a unique name. To modify an existing ID namespace, use the UpdateIdNamespace API.

parameters.name: idNamespaceName
parameters.description: The name of the ID namespace.

parameters.name: inputSourceConfig
parameters.description: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName. (dict) --- An object containing InputSourceARN and SchemaName. An Glue table Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a matching workflow ARN for the input source table. schemaName (string) --- The name of the schema.

nested_params.name: inputSourceARN
nested_params.description: An Glue table Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a matching workflow ARN for the input source table.

parameters.name: idMappingWorkflowProperties
parameters.description: Determines the properties of IdMappingWorflow where this IdNamespace can be used as a Source or a Target. (dict) --- An object containing IdMappingType, ProviderProperties, and RuleBasedProperties. The type of ID mapping. ruleBasedProperties (dict) --- An object which defines any additional configurations required by rule-based matching. rules (list) --- The rules for the ID namespace. (dict) --- An object containing RuleName, and MatchingKeys. A name for the matching rule. A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match. (string) --- ruleDefinitionTypes (list) --- The sets of rules you can use in an ID mapping workflow. The limitations specified for the source and target must be compatible. (string) --- attributeMatchingModel (string) --- The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the attributeMatchingModel. If you choose MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of BusinessEmail field of Profile B, the two profiles are matched on the Email attribute type. If you choose ONE_TO_ONE, the system can only match attributes if the sub-types are an exact match. For example, for the Email attribute type, the system will only consider it a match if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the Email field of Profile B. recordMatchingModels (list) --- The type of matching record that is allowed to be used in an ID mapping workflow. If the value is set to ONE_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, only one record in the source is matched to one record in the target. If the value is set to MANY_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, all matching records in the source are matched to one record in the target. (string) --- providerProperties (dict) --- An object which defines any additional configurations required by the provider service. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the provider service. providerConfiguration (document) --- An object which defines any additional configurations required by the provider service.

nested_params.name: ruleBasedProperties
nested_params.description: An object which defines any additional configurations required by rule-based matching.

nested_params.name: rules
nested_params.description: The rules for the ID namespace.

nested_params.name: ruleName
nested_params.description: A name for the matching rule.

nested_params.name: matchingKeys
nested_params.description: A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match.

nested_params.name: ruleDefinitionTypes
nested_params.description: The sets of rules you can use in an ID mapping workflow. The limitations specified for the source and target must be compatible.

nested_params.name: attributeMatchingModel
nested_params.description: The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the attributeMatchingModel. If you choose MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of BusinessEmail field of Profile B, the two profiles are matched on the Email attribute type. If you choose ONE_TO_ONE, the system can only match attributes if the sub-types are an exact match. For example, for the Email attribute type, the system will only consider it a match if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the Email field of Profile B.

nested_params.name: recordMatchingModels
nested_params.description: The type of matching record that is allowed to be used in an ID mapping workflow. If the value is set to ONE_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, only one record in the source is matched to one record in the target. If the value is set to MANY_SOURCE_TO_ONE_TARGET, all matching records in the source are matched to one record in the target.

nested_params.name: providerProperties
nested_params.description: An object which defines any additional configurations required by the provider service.

nested_params.name: providerServiceArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the provider service.

nested_params.name: providerConfiguration
nested_params.description: An object which defines any additional configurations required by the provider service.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of ID namespace. There are two types: SOURCE and TARGET. The SOURCE contains configurations for sourceId data that will be processed in an ID mapping workflow. The TARGET contains a configuration of targetId to which all sourceIds will resolve to.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to access the resources defined in inputSourceConfig on your behalf as part of the workflow run.
